result.execSummary:
The defendant Savannah M Hilt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

No contact with J. Allen other than by text message solely for the purpose of discussing their child in common. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Savannah M Hilt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:17 p.m. Defendant Savannah M Hilt in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have reached an agreement. Information stated. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Possession of an Illegally Obtained Prescription - PTAC contrary to Wis Stat 450.11(7)(h). Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by DE. Court orders: 4 months WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: NC w/ J. Allen other than by text message soley for the purpose of discussing their child in common, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA sample and surcharge. Appeal rights given.

Case Called @ 3:05 PM: Defendant Savannah M Hilt in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  Believes that pre-lim will be waived today.  Offer has been extended and agreement recited by DA.  Def agrees with State's recital.   ARGN will not proceed today.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary full waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Probable Cause demonstrated as to charge in Criminal Complaint. Def BOT.  INFO Filed.  INFO stated - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  ARGN Scheduled - NOH Given.  Arraignment scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Savannah M Hilt
Current: 105 E. Griswald St, Ripon, WI 54971 United States  (Effective: 07-27-2015)
Prior: 606 1/2 State St, Ripon, WI 54971

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:11 p.m. Defendant Savannah M Hilt in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. Atty Zilles requesting a preliminary hearing.  The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. ADA Anderson requesting $2500 Sig Bond. Statement by Atty Zilles regarding bond. Court orders $2500 Sig Bond. Preliminary hearing Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
